4XZ.F.summary: Fleury Michon SA produces and sells food products in France and internationally. It offers cold meats, ready meals, fresh surimi, chicken breast, ham and other cured meats, turkey breast, hot snack, spreads/pate, ingredients for cooking, pan-fried meat, raw ham and other cured meats, and roasted and cooked meat. The company offers its products through stores. Fleury Michon SA was founded in 1905 and is headquartered in La Meilleraie-Tillay, France.

ALFLE.PA.summary: Fleury Michon SA produces and sells food products in France and internationally. It offers cold meats, ready meals, fresh surimi, chicken breast, ham and other cured meats, turkey breast, hot snack, spreads/pate, ingredients for cooking, pan-fried meat, raw ham and other cured meats, and roasted and cooked meat. The company offers its products through stores. Fleury Michon SA was founded in 1905 and is headquartered in La Meilleraie-Tillay, France.

ALPAU.PA.summary: PAULIC Meunerie SA produces and sells wheat and buckwheat flour for professionals in the bakery, crÃªperie, and food industry in France and internationally. The company was founded in 1957 and is based in Pontivy, France.

ALPOU.PA.summary: Poulaillon SA manufactures and markets frozen bakery and pastry goods in France. It provides breads, pastries, sandwiches, moricettes, mignardises, entremets, cakes, etc. It also offers catering services. The company was founded in 2007 and is headquartered in Wittelsheim, France.

BDU.F.summary: Bonduelle SCA produces and sells vegetables and fruits in Europe and internationally. It offers canned, frozen, and ready-to-eat prepared and fresh-cut ready-to use vegetables, as well as prepared salads. The company provides its products under the Bonduelle, Cassegrain, Arctic Gardens, Globus, Ready Pac Foods, and Del Monte brands. Bonduelle SCA was founded in 1853 and is headquartered in Renescure, France.

BGJ.F.summary: Savencia SA produces and distributes cheese and other dairy ingredients in France and internationally. It also offers butter, cream, sauces, and dairy desserts; desserts and preparations; cream cheese for cheesecakes; cheese for platters and sandwiches; cheese portions; cheese for culinary uses; dairy-based nutritional and functional ingredients; and cheese ingredients. The company provides butter and cream products for retail and food service sectors, as well as dairy ingredients for the food, infant formula, and pharmaceutical industries under the Elle & Vire, Corman, Caprice des Dieux, Saint Albray, Le Rustique, CÂur de Lion, Saint Agur, Bresse Bleu, St-MorÃªt, Tartare, CarrÃ© Frais, ApÃ©rivrais, Chavroux and Saint-Loup, RichesMonts raclette, Savencia Fromage & Dairy, GÃ©ramont, Saint Albray, Bresso, Milkana, Brunch, Lucina, Medve, Alouette, Polenghi, KrÃ¡l SÃ½ru, Fol Epi, Liptov, and Balade brands. The company was formerly known as Bongrain SA and changed its name to Savencia SA in April 2015. Savencia SA is based in Viroflay, France.

BN.PA.summary: Danone S.A. operates in the food and beverage industry in Europe, Noram, Latin America, the Asia Pacific, Africa, and the Middle East. The company operates through three segments: Essential Dairy & Plant-Based, Specialized Nutrition, and Waters. It produces and distributes yogurts; milk products; coffee creamers, drinks, and beverages; plant-based products; and ice creams, desserts, and nutritional powdered protein products under the Danone, Danonino or Prostokvashino, Light & Free, Actimel, Activia, Oikos, Danette, Danissimo, YoPRO, Horizon, SToK, Silk, So Delicious, Vega, and Alpro brands, as well as under the license brands, including International Delight, Dunkin' Donuts, and Bailey's. In addition, it offers specialized nutrition products for pregnant and breastfeeding mothers, infants, and young children under the Aptamil, Nutrilon, Gallia, Cow & Gate, BlÃ©dina, Bebelac, Olvarit, and Happy Family Organics brands. Further, the company provides tube feeding products under the Nutrison name; oral nutritional supplements under the Fortimel and NutriDrink names; and hypoallergenic products for children with allergies primarily under the Aptamil ProSyneo, Aptamil Pepti Syneo, and Neocate Syneo names. Additionally, it offers water with natural fruit extracts, fruit juice, and vitamins under the evian, Volvic, Aqua, Mizone, Bonafont, Villavicencio, Villa del Sur, Hayat, Sirma, Fontvella, LanjarÃ³n, Salus, Aqua d'Or, and Zywiec Zdroj brands. The company distributes its products through retail chains and traditional market outlets; convenience stores; hospitals, clinics, and pharmacies; and e-commerce. The company was formerly known as Groupe Danone and changed its name to Danone S.A. in April 2009. Danone S.A. was founded in 1899 and is based in Paris, France.

FBEL.PA.summary: Bel SociÃ©tÃ© anonyme produces and distributes cheese in the Americas, Asia-Pacific, Europe, Middle East, and Greater Africa. The company offers its products under core brands, including The Laughing Cow, Kiri, Mini Babybel, Leerdammer, Boursin, Pom'Potes, and GoGo squeeZ. It also provides institutional catering services to commercial catering companies, school canteens, residential homes, and fast food caterers. The company was formerly known as Fromageries Bel SA. Bel SociÃ©tÃ© anonyme was founded in 1865 and is headquartered in Suresnes, France. Bel SociÃ©tÃ© anonyme is a subsidiary of Unibel SA.

LOUP.PA.summary: L.D.C. S.A. produces, sells, and exports poultry products in France, Poland, Spain, and internationally. The company operates in Poultry and Convenience divisions. It is involved in breeding pork, cattle, and rabbits; collecting cereals and agricultural supplies; producing, sorting, packaging, and selling eggs; and slaughtering activities. The company also offers fresh and frozen foods, including ready meals, pizzas, pancakes, exotic meals, and sandwiches; and pastries, quiches, tarts, pies, cooked meats, and sauces. In addition, it provides poultry-cuts and processed products, as well as other kinds of poultry, such as ducks and geese. The company offers its products under the Le Gaulois, MaÃ®tre CoQ, LouÃ©, Marie, and Traditions d'Asie brands. L.D.C. S.A. was founded in 1968 and is based in SablÃ©-sur-Sarthe, France.

MLFDV.PA.summary: FD produces and sells macaroons. The company was founded in 2003 and is based in Roche la Moliere, France.

MLOSA.PA.summary: O Sorbet D'amour SA provides homemade ice creams and sorbets in France. It offers frozen desserts, meringues with caramel chips, salted butter crÃ¨me caramel, nut brittle hearts, crepes, waffles, and hot and cold drinks. The company was founded in 1935 and is headquartered in La Teste, France.

SABE.PA.summary: Saint Jean Groupe SociÃ©tÃ© anonyme, through its subsidiaries, operates in the agri-food sector in France. The company offers ravioles, quenelles, fresh pasta, and delicatessen products under the Saint Jean, Royans, Ravioles de Romans, Quenelles La Royale, and Comptoir du Pastier brand names. It is also involved in various agricultural activities; and the management of real estate land located in the Crau plain. The company was formerly known as Sabeton SA. The company is headquartered in Dardilly, France.

TIPI.PA.summary: Tipiak SociÃ©tÃ© Anonyme, a food company, manufactures prepared food products, frozen ready-meals, pastry products, groceries, and crusty bread products. The company offers groceries, such as breadcrumbs, cereals, couscous, croutons, Japanese pearls, potato starch, quinoa, and tapioca; frozen products, including savory products, appetizers, and side dishes with grains; and frozen sweet products comprising macarons, mini eclairs, and petits fours. It sells its products in France, England, and the United States. The company was founded in 1830 and is based in Saint-Aignan-Grandlieu, France.

UNBL.PA.summary: Unibel S.A., through its subsidiary, produces and sells cheese products. The company was founded in 1921 and is headquartered in Paris, France.
